summary:
My degree and my knowledge in data science and information theory field has prepared me for a position in data science (R&D). I completed a full pipeline for data processing originating from gas chromatography, from pre-processing up to (and including) multivariate analysis, coupling my two projects: PyChromics and SuPP.  
   My experience in analytical data processing and supervision involved a great deal of independent research, requiring initiative, leadership skills, self-motivation and a wide range of other skills.
I am a fast learner, with a continuous interest to enhance my knowledge.

profile_positions.description: My main responsibility is to lead the team of Signatures and Biomarkers and manage the research that my team is involved in. Together with my team, I successfully achieved the goals set by Agendia in the development of novel signatures. We applied state of the art techniques in machine learning (ML) such as SVM, PLS-DA, Mixture model, regression etc. and advanced statistics (Bayesian statistics) to bring the best to Agendia's portfolio. I am extremely proud of my team's achievements and their evolution for the past year.
profile_positions.title: Principal Scientist Signatures and Biomarkers

profile_positions.description: In my role as senior data scientist for the precision oncology, I created novel signatures and improved the existing products which are approved by the FDA and used in Breast cancer prognostic and diagnostics. I combined my knowledge in Machine learning, Bayesian stats and my experience in clinical data analysis from my previous positions and considerably improved the products in Agendia. Important and key achievements  are developing of new signatures used in Breast cancer classification, reproducibility assessment, improving the stability of the classifier and last but not least scientific report writing and presentations.
profile_positions.title: Senior Data Scientist

profile_positions.description: Development of algorithms for data processing and statistical analysis. Metabolomics data analysis from GC-MS, LC-MS and questionnaires. Provision with statistical expertise (significance tests, variable selection and experimental design). Multivariate analysis of big data sets from one of the largest population cohort (LifeLines) using the most advanced machine learning techniques (LASSO, Random Forest, PLS-DA, PCA, Naive Bayes etc). Development of pre-processing pipeline for the laboratory medicine, in Python script, capable of loading multiple data sets and providing quantitative tables used for further diagnoses and/or statistical analysis. I developed a novel multivariate data analysis technique called Supervised Projection Pursuit (doi:10.1016/j.chemolab.2019.103867) that is very useful in multivariate data analysis and probabilistic classifications.
profile_positions.title: Researcher Statistician and Data Analyst

profile_positions.description:
Application of statistics and Machine Learning in various research questions such as: Risk assessment of the exposure to mycotoxins of the population of Qatar, Effect of the oxidative stress on the blood storage of athletes and others. Provision with statistical analysis of various large data sets of proteomics and metabolomics obtained with LC-MS and GC-MS. Application of the state-of-the-art techniques in Machine Learning (such as Random Forest, Bayesian statistics and multivariate exploratory data analysis) in Life Science projects.
Various statistical evaluations for GC-MS data in the diagnostics of inborn errors of metabolism needed for diagnosis and research questions. Programming applications were mainly made in Python and Matlab. (Basic utilization of R was also included).
profile_positions.title: Researcher statistician

profile_positions.description: Algorithm development for analytical data treatment. The algorithms are based on Bayesian statistics and Information technology and mainly written in MATLAB. The challenging tasks are focused on information retrieval from big data obtained by analytical chemists (Main sources of data: NFI, DSM, RIKILT and University of Amsterdam). Part of the job included modelling of the two dimensional gas chromatographic system together with validation and error assessment of the predicted output.
profile_positions.title: Researcher PHD Student

Data processing and programming in MATLAB.
Observations over the results and workflow proposal.
profile_positions.title: Junior Research Engineer

profile_positions.description:
Based on numerical simulation results, derived parameters computed from output variables and represented in
3D are used to have a clearer approach to the hydrodynamics of real systems. More precisely, a 3D dynamic
visualization of the Shannon entropy of the velocity direction ﬁeld is shown to illustrate the horizontal mixing
related to the ﬂow dynamics in the case of the Aral and Black sea applications. more details in the link bellow.
profile_positions.title: 3D visualization of derived hydrophysical parameters in Lakes and Inland Seas.

Front-end development of the webpage.
